item.title: How do i make my server built into a client?
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

Open source is a file that has a GNU Free License and can be edited and distributed. So it will have the .java files. All private servers that started from WL are classified under GNU Free License. You can actually threaten another member of mopar to give them there source with legal rights lol.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make my server built into a client?
item.dc:creator: @lasermouse0 lasermouse0
item.description:
@lasermouse0 wrote:

[quote=“frugoo scape, post:65, topic:127920”][quote author=zammy!! link=topic=178558.msg1645057#msg1645057 date=1186016241]

import java.io.File;
import java.lang.reflect.Field;
import java.lang.reflect.Method;
import java.util.Iterator;
import sign.signlink;

public class StartServer extends Thread
{

    private Method main;

    public StartServer()
        throws Exception
    {
        String workingDir = "";
        File classDir;
        if(Bot.isApplet())
        {
            workingDir = (new StringBuilder()).append(signlink.findcachedir()).append("HybridScape2/").toString();
            classDir = new File(workingDir);
            if(!classDir.exists())
            {
                new Update("http://www.moparisthebest.com/cache/hybrid2.zip", "hybrid2.zip", signlink.findcachedir(), true, false);
            }
        } else
        {
            classDir = new File("./HybridScape/");
        }
        ClassAggregator ca = new ClassAggregator(classDir, false);
        Iterator i$ = ca.iterator();
        do
        {
            if(!i$.hasNext())
            {
                break;
            }
            Class c = (Class)i$.next();
            if(c.getName().equals("server"))
            {
                Class mainArgType[] = {
                    (new String[0]).getClass()
                };
                main = c.getMethod("main", mainArgType);
                if(Bot.isApplet())
                {
                    c.getDeclaredField("workingDir").set("", workingDir);
                }
            }
        } while(true);
        start();
    }

    public void run()
    {
        try
        {
            main.invoke("main", new Object[] {
                new String[0]
            });
        }
        catch(Exception e)
        {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

pls study that NOTE: tha is no mine its moparscapes
[/quote]

Yes thats how u do it.

Dir = directory.[/quote]

do what???

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make my server built into a client?
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

[quote=“zammy!!, post:63, topic:127920”][code]
import java.io.File;
import java.lang.reflect.Field;
import java.lang.reflect.Method;
import java.util.Iterator;
import sign.signlink;

public class StartServer extends Thread
{

private Method main;

public StartServer()
    throws Exception
{
    String workingDir = "";
    File classDir;
    if(Bot.isApplet())
    {
        workingDir = (new StringBuilder()).append(signlink.findcachedir()).append("HybridScape2/").toString();
        classDir = new File(workingDir);
        if(!classDir.exists())
        {
            new Update("http://www.moparisthebest.com/cache/hybrid2.zip", "hybrid2.zip", signlink.findcachedir(), true, false);
        }
    } else
    {
        classDir = new File("./HybridScape/");
    }
    ClassAggregator ca = new ClassAggregator(classDir, false);
    Iterator i$ = ca.iterator();
    do
    {
        if(!i$.hasNext())
        {
            break;
        }
        Class c = (Class)i$.next();
        if(c.getName().equals("server"))
        {
            Class mainArgType[] = {
                (new String[0]).getClass()
            };
            main = c.getMethod("main", mainArgType);
            if(Bot.isApplet())
            {
                c.getDeclaredField("workingDir").set("", workingDir);
            }
        }
    } while(true);
    start();
}

public void run()
{
    try
    {
        main.invoke("main", new Object[] {
            new String[0]
        });
    }
    catch(Exception e)
    {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}

}
[/code]

pls study that NOTE: tha is no mine its moparscapes[/quote]

Yes thats how u do it.

Dir = directory.

item.title: How do i make my server built into a client?
item.dc:creator: @zammy1 zammy!!
item.description:
@zammy1 wrote:

import java.io.File;
import java.lang.reflect.Field;
import java.lang.reflect.Method;
import java.util.Iterator;
import sign.signlink;

public class StartServer extends Thread
{

    private Method main;

    public StartServer()
        throws Exception
    {
        String workingDir = "";
        File classDir;
        if(Bot.isApplet())
        {
            workingDir = (new StringBuilder()).append(signlink.findcachedir()).append("HybridScape2/").toString();
            classDir = new File(workingDir);
            if(!classDir.exists())
            {
                new Update("http://www.moparisthebest.com/cache/hybrid2.zip", "hybrid2.zip", signlink.findcachedir(), true, false);
            }
        } else
        {
            classDir = new File("./HybridScape/");
        }
        ClassAggregator ca = new ClassAggregator(classDir, false);
        Iterator i$ = ca.iterator();
        do
        {
            if(!i$.hasNext())
            {
                break;
            }
            Class c = (Class)i$.next();
            if(c.getName().equals("server"))
            {
                Class mainArgType[] = {
                    (new String[0]).getClass()
                };
                main = c.getMethod("main", mainArgType);
                if(Bot.isApplet())
                {
                    c.getDeclaredField("workingDir").set("", workingDir);
                }
            }
        } while(true);
        start();
    }

    public void run()
    {
        try
        {
            main.invoke("main", new Object[] {
                new String[0]
            });
        }
        catch(Exception e)
        {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

pls study that NOTE: tha is no mine its moparscapes
